1Client's reason for the prevention visit0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de1#Observation.value[x]
2Client is visiting for the recommended 3-month pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) visit0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de7#Observation.value[x]
3The client is currently taking PrEP. Oral pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) of HIV is the use of ARV drugs by people who are not infected with HIV to block the acquisition of HIV.0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de10#Observation.value[x]
4Way in which pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) is taken (daily or event-driven)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de11#Observation.value[x]
5Other PrEP dosing type (specify)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de15#Observation.value[x]
6Client reports taking ED-PrEP for at risk exposures over a 3-month period0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de16#Observation.value[x]
7HIV pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) regimen0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de17#Observation.value[x]
8The client's experience in taking PrEP0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de24#Observation.value[x]
9The date on which the client started or restarted pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de28#Observation.value[x]
10Client stopped taking pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de29#Observation.value[x]
11Date client stopped taking pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de30#Observation.value[x]
12The client's history in taking post-exposure prophylaxis (PEP) for HIV prevention0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de31#Observation.value[x]
13Dates when the client previously used post-exposure prophylaxis (PEP)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de34#Observation.value[x]
14Date client completes PEP course0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de35#Observation.value[x]
15Signs the client is at a substantial risk of HIV infection0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de36#Observation.value[x]
16Client's intention or desire in the next year to either become pregnant or prevent a future pregnancy (in serodiscordant partnerships)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de41#Observation.value[x]
17Symptoms that could suggest an acute HIV infection0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de46#Observation.value[x]
18Treatment adherence of client's sex partner for partners that are HIV-positive0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de55#Observation.value[x]
19The client is suitable for PrEP0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de61#Observation.value[x]
20After being evaluated as suitable for PrEP, the client was offered PrEP0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de62#Observation.value[x]
21Listing of tests for clients on or starting pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) that may be recommended or should be considered0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de63#Observation.value[x]
22Test serum creatinine to identify pre-existing renal disease (estimated creatinine clearance less than 60 ml/min)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de71#Observation.value[x]
23Test serum creatinine to identify pre-existing renal disease (estimated creatinine clearance less than 60 ml/min).0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de72#Observation.value[x]
24Date the client was dispensed medications0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de73#Observation.value[x]
25Date the client was prescribed medications0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de74#Observation.value[x]
26Medications the client was prescribed0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de75#Observation.value[x]
27PrEP product that the client was prescribed0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de80#Observation.value[x]
28Date client was prescribed PrEP, including initial prescription and repeats0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de86#Observation.value[x]
29Date client was dispensed PrEP0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de87#Observation.value[x]
30Volume of PrEP product the client was prescribed or dispensed (for example, number of pills, number of devices)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de88#Observation.value[x]
31Date the client was prescribed PEP0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de89#Observation.value[x]
32Date client completes PEP course0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de90#Observation.value[x]
33Preferred backbone regimen for PEP0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de91#Observation.value[x]
34Alternative backbone regimen for PEP0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de95#Observation.value[x]
35Preferred third drug for PEP0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de99#Observation.value[x]
36Alternative third drug for PEP0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de101#Observation.value[x]
37Estimated creatinine clearance of the client returned from lab in mL/min0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de106#Observation.value[x]
38Value used for gender for calculating creatinine clearance if required. For transgender populations, the sex at birth is used in the Cockcroft-Gault equation if the person is not using hormone therapy; among transgender populations using hormone therapy for more than three months, the current gender can be used.0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de107#Observation.value[x]
39If the laboratory does not have the capacity to estimate creatinine clearance, the provider can use the CockcroftGault equation to calculate estimated creatinine clearance based on measured serum creatinine, the clients sex at birth, age and estimated lean body weight.0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de110#Observation.value[x]
40Date when the specimen was collected0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de111#Observation.value[x]
41Listing of contraindications to pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de112#Observation.value[x]
42Client has another allergy or contraindication to a medicine in the pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) regimen (specify)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de119#Observation.value[x]
43Client was prescribed pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) on a first visit0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de120#Observation.value[x]
44Days of medication client has been prescribed0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de121#Observation.value[x]
45HIV pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) regimen prescribed0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de122#Observation.value[x]
46Whether adherence counselling was provided0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de123#Observation.value[x]
47Linkage made from HIV testing to enrolment in care following an HIV diagnosis0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de130#Observation.value[x]
48Date client was provided with condoms0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de136#Observation.value[x]
49Number of condoms given to the client, if any were distributed0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de137#Observation.value[x]
50Type of condom provided to client0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de138#Observation.value[x]
51Whether any HIV self-test kits were given to the client0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de141#Observation.value[x]
52Number of HIV self-test kits distributed to the client0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de142#Observation.value[x]
53Whom the client plans to give the HIV self-test kit (self, sexual partner, social contact, etc.)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de143#Observation.value[x]
54Offer testing for all partners and biological children of positive cases (includes partner services and index case testing), as well as partners and social contacts of people from key populations, where appropriate0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de156#Observation.value[x]

Documentation for this format

item.text: Client's reason for the prevention visit
Client is visiting for the recommended 3-month pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) visit
The client is currently taking PrEP. Oral pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) of HIV is the use of ARV drugs by people who are not infected with HIV to block the acquisition of HIV.
Way in which pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) is taken (daily or event-driven)
Other PrEP dosing type (specify)
Client reports taking ED-PrEP for at risk exposures over a 3-month period
HIV pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) regimen
The client's experience in taking PrEP
The date on which the client started or restarted pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP)
Client stopped taking pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP)
Date client stopped taking pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP)
The client's history in taking post-exposure prophylaxis (PEP) for HIV prevention
Dates when the client previously used post-exposure prophylaxis (PEP)
Date client completes PEP course
Signs the client is at a substantial risk of HIV infection
Client's intention or desire in the next year to either become pregnant or prevent a future pregnancy (in serodiscordant partnerships)
Symptoms that could suggest an acute HIV infection
Treatment adherence of client's sex partner for partners that are HIV-positive
The client is suitable for PrEP
After being evaluated as suitable for PrEP, the client was offered PrEP
Listing of tests for clients on or starting pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) that may be recommended or should be considered
Test serum creatinine to identify pre-existing renal disease (estimated creatinine clearance less than 60 ml/min)
Test serum creatinine to identify pre-existing renal disease (estimated creatinine clearance less than 60 ml/min).
Date the client was dispensed medications
Date the client was prescribed medications
Medications the client was prescribed
PrEP product that the client was prescribed
Date client was prescribed PrEP, including initial prescription and repeats
Date client was dispensed PrEP
Volume of PrEP product the client was prescribed or dispensed (for example, number of pills, number of devices)
Date the client was prescribed PEP
Date client completes PEP course
Preferred backbone regimen for PEP
Alternative backbone regimen for PEP
Preferred third drug for PEP
Alternative third drug for PEP
Estimated creatinine clearance of the client returned from lab in mL/min

Value used for gender for calculating creatinine clearance if required. For transgender populations, the sex at birth is used in the Cockcroft-Gault equation if the person is not using hormone therapy; among transgender populations using hormone therapy for more than three months, the current gender can be used.

If the laboratory does not have the capacity to estimate creatinine clearance, the provider can use the CockcroftGault equation to calculate estimated creatinine clearance based on measured serum creatinine, the clients sex at birth, age and estimated lean body weight.
Date when the specimen was collected
Listing of contraindications to pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP)
Client has another allergy or contraindication to a medicine in the pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) regimen (specify)
Client was prescribed pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) on a first visit
Days of medication client has been prescribed
HIV pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) regimen prescribed
Whether adherence counselling was provided
Linkage made from HIV testing to enrolment in care following an HIV diagnosis
Date client was provided with condoms
Number of condoms given to the client, if any were distributed
Type of condom provided to client
Whether any HIV self-test kits were given to the client
Number of HIV self-test kits distributed to the client
Whom the client plans to give the HIV self-test kit (self, sexual partner, social contact, etc.)

Offer testing for all partners and biological children of positive cases (includes partner services and index case testing), as well as partners and social contacts of people from key populations, where appropriate
